title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.28 | 18-06-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: Lot of tapasya they have done to get that position.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse and explains that the intimate devotees of Krishna, like the wives and gopis, attained their position through vows, sacrifices, and worship, emphasizing the importance of purification.

segments.key_quote: There is a lot of difference between bhakti and karma. Bhakti is completely spiritual. Karma is material.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada's purport is discussed, highlighting the need to purify material qualities through religious rituals to render transcendental service to Krishna, differentiating between material karma and spiritual bhakti.

segments.key_quote: Liberation means renovation of this stage of Swarupa.
segments.summary: The concept of Swarupa (factual identity) is explained as the highest perfection and liberation, emphasizing the importance of establishing a loving relationship with Krishna through five phases of loving service.

segments.key_quote: Krishna however in spite of being full in himself he becomes a master a friend a son or a husband to fulfill the intense love of the devotee concern
segments.summary: Krishna's self-sufficiency and his willingness to reciprocate the love of his devotees are discussed, along with the different relationships (Madhurya Rasa) and the distinction between Swakhiya (married queens) and Parakhiya (unmarried gopis) relationships with Krishna.

segments.key_quote: All those things are not end in themselves, but they are means to attain the highest stage of Swaroopa.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the penances undertaken by the gopis and queens to attain their positions, emphasizing that rituals and knowledge are means to achieve Swaroopa and render transcendental loving service to the Lord.

segments.key_quote: And it is a transcendental position. It is not a material position.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing that the loving exchanges with Krishna are transcendental, not material, and highlights the involvement of figures like Shukadeva Goswami and Chaitanya Mahaprabhu in these topics, reinforcing the spiritual nature of the subject.
